intro: Dimorphanthera denticulifera var. pubens, commonly known as the hairy dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
